Abstract: Hans-Georg Metzler, who heads research on 'machine understanding' at DaimlerChrysler in Stuttgart, Germany, says a car will one day be able to take information from its surroundings and put it to use much as the human brain does; foresees 'drive-by-wire' systems that would fundamentally change the relationship between driver and car (M)
Snippet: Hans-Georg Metzler, who heads research on 'machine understanding' at DaimlerChrysler in Stuttgart, Germany, says a car will one day be able to take information from its surroundings and put it to use much as the human brain does; foresees 'drive-b...
LeadParagraph: HANS-GEORG METZLER envisions the day when he has conversations with his car.

Headline.Kicker: VISIONS: TECHNOLOGY: QUANTUM COMPUTERS AND CARS SMARTER THAN YOU ARE
Headline.PrintHeadline: VISIONS: TECHNOLOGY: QUANTUM COMPUTERS AND CARS SMARTER THAN YOU ARE; A New Meaning For Automatic
